input_text:
Job Title: Sr Software Engineer - Synthetic Vision - 10K Sign on Bonus

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

$10K Sign on Bonus and Relocation Assistance (Can be based out of Phoenix, AZ OR Olathe, KS)

The Future Is What You Make It.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.

Whether we’re turning mustard seeds into fuel, creating quantum algorithms or making taxis fly, our software engineering team is home to the world’s leading technological talent.

Honeywell Anthem Avionics Is The Future Of Flight

Honeywell Anthem is the Aviation Industry's first Cloud-Connected Cockpit system, featuring cloud-native communications, navigation, and surveillance systems, powered by a flexible software platform that can be customized for virtually every type of aircraft, from passenger planes and business aircraft to defense, general aviation and the rapidly emerging class of Advanced Air-Mobility (AAM) vehicles.

Honeywell’s newest and most advanced flight deck will herald a new age of aviation where connectivity will help enable true autonomy. 

Join our team of innovators as we design, develop and deploy cutting-edge software solutions within Honeywell's Next-Generation Anthem Avionics Displays. In this role, you will impact the advancement of cutting-edge avionics technology for Honeywell's Synthetic Vision System (SVS) known as SmartView.

SmartView combines a high-resolution display, databases of terrain and Global Positioning System (GPS) technology to show pilots exactly where they are and how the aircraft is oriented. Honeywell’s Synthetic Vision technology provides a 3-D view of the surrounding terrain, obstacles, and runways fused with advanced symbols. The computer-generated terrain imagery dramatically increases situational awareness and is rendered from Honeywell’s Enhanced Ground Proximity Warning System (EGPWS) database

Key Responsibilities

Your work will contribute to the development of cutting-edge technologies that enhance the situational awareness and decision-making capabilities of pilots.

Leverage your expertise in software engineering to drive innovation and deliver high-quality solutionsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze and understand project requirements and technical specifications Design, develop, and test software applications for display systems, ensuring high performance, reliability, and user-friendliness.Software architecture and codingIntegrationCertificationFeature DefinitionVerification and Validation

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status.

YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering or mathematics. 5+ years of Software Engineering experience 

WE VALUE

Displays DevelopmentGraphics Core Development or Synthetic Vision DevelopmentSCADE Tool ExperienceExperience with Avionics products desirable i.e. Avionics Displays & Graphics, Flight Mgmt, Flight Planning, Flight Controls, Flight Displays (PFD), Traffic Collision Avoidance (TCAS), Crew Alert Messaging (CAS), Terrain, Radios, etcExperience operating in an Agile frameworkUnderstanding various software development lifecyclesKnowledge of software configuration management and change management practicesDiverse and global teaming and collaboration

Benefits

We offer a full benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), flexible vacation and education assistance. Benefits provided may differ by role and location.

Visit benefits.honeywell.com to learn more.

Additional Information

JOB ID: req440880Category: EngineeringLocation: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United StatesExempt

Engineering (GLOBAL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
